Name: No dominant order
Description: Both orders with neither order dominant

Name: No dominant order
Description: More than one adposition type with none dominant

Name: NoDom
Description: no dominant order of genitive modifier and nominal head

Name: No dominant order
Description: Both orders occur with neither order dominant

Name: mixed
Description: no dominant order of demonstrative and nominal head

Name: Demonstrative before and after Noun
Description: Demonstrative simultaneously before and after noun

Name: Mixed
Description: Two or more of above types with none dominant

Name: True
Description: There is a distinct definite article.

Name: False
Description: There is no distinct definite article.

Name: True
Description: A demonstrative is systematically used as third person pronoun (i.e. no distinct third person pronoun).

Name: False
Description: There is a third person pronoun distinct from the demonstrative.

Name: y
Description: There are attested instances of (ad)nominal person marking.

Name: n
Description: There are explicit and plausible claims about the lack of adnominal person marking.

Name: both
Description: adnominal pronouns can precede and follow the nominal

Name: pre
Description: bound person marker precedes nominal core

Name: post
Description: bound person marker follows nominal core

Name: n
Description: no evidence for bound person constructions

Name: all
Description: any person can be marked adnominally

Name: no 3
Description: no adnominal marking for third person

Name: only 3
Description: sources suggest only third person expressions allowed adnominally

Name: y
Description: third person adnominal person is attested

Name: n
Description: third person adnominal person is ruled out, cf. English *they linguists

Name: only 3
Description: adnominal person attested only for third person

Name: all
Description: no reported number restrictions on adnominal person marking

Name: non-sg
Description: only non-singular pronouns in adnominal person marking

Name: nonum
Description: no grammatical number marking on pronouns

Name: unclear (+pl)
Description: plural is attested, other numbers unclear but feasible

Name: y_nn
Description: attested PPDCs include only demonstrative and PersN-marking, but no lexical material

Name: n
Description: sufficient indications that PPDC is not available
